course_title: Freshman Seminar: French: What is African Cinema?
class_notes:
(Same as AFS 190 1)
(Freshmen Seminar - Limited to First Year Students Only)
This course introduces students to films about Africa and films made in Africa to study their cinematic richness and diversity, to capture their struggles and their socio-political and aesthetic significance. Students will watch 12 films over the course of the semester from all over the African continent and learn to ask questions about cinematic style, reception, meaning and impact. Selected films will include Paulin Soumanou Vieyra,  Afrique sur Seine (1955), Ousmane Sembène, Black Girl (1966), Sarah Maldoror, Sambiznga (1972), Djibril Diop Mambéty, Touki Bouki (1973), Jean-Marie Teno, Africa I will fleece you (1992), Haile Gerima, Teza (2008), Kemi Adetiba, The Wedding Party (2016), Mati Diop, Atlantique (2019), Mounia Meddour, Papicha (2019), Petna Ndaliko Katondolo, Kumbuka (2022).
course_description: This freshman seminar will focus on themes in French culture from social history, the arts, and current information media. Cross-cultural comparisons provide a rich basis for discussion.
